Functions/Subroutines | Variables

KSmodel Module Reference

all the routines required to setup and subsequently calculate the KS model at a given position and time. This is used as as a normal fluid in the code. The KS model is a model of a turbulent like velocity field created throught the summation of random fourier modes

where , is the number of modes, and are their wave vectors and frequencies. More...

Functions/Subroutines

subroutine get_KS_flow (x, u)
 return the KS flow (u) at a given position x, t is a global variable which is used in here (flow is time dependent)
subroutine setup_KS
 the main routine to setup the KS flow, only performed once at the start of a run. KS vectors held within this module to be used by the get_KS_flow routine.
subroutine wavenumbers
 generate the KS wavenumbers
subroutine order (ad_, i_N, i_ord, B)
 bubble sorting algorithm used to order random KS modes
subroutine calc_KS_amplitudes
 Get our A's & B's that are perpendicular to k for each of our N wave-vectors k. This is done by making 2 extra random vectors, j & l and taking the cross product of these with k.

 arrays needed for the setup only

real, dimension(:), allocatable KS_energy

Detailed Description

all the routines required to setup and subsequently calculate the KS model at a given position and time. This is used as as a normal fluid in the code. The KS model is a model of a turbulent like velocity field created throught the summation of random fourier modes

where , is the number of modes, and are their wave vectors and frequencies.
